title: NCarolina Town Votes to Disband...

organizations.name: one tiny north carolina town votes

text:
One Tiny North Carolina Town Votes to Disband Facing financial crises and dwindling populations, some U.S. towns consider becoming unincorporated By Google+ March 5, 2017 8:00 a.m. ET 
CENTERVILLE, N.C.—This crossroads town of 89 people in northeastern North Carolina started out with big dreams more than a century ago, but now it is ready to cease to exist. 
The mayor and council members voted to dissolve the town’s charter and become unincorporated in January, after a measure to raise property taxes failed. A state senator brought a bill last month to repeal the town’s charter. 
Centerville isn’t alone.... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
